title: Commending Firefighter John J. Maes upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition after 35 years of dedicated service
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Firefighter  John  J. Maes upon the
occasion of his designation for special recognition after  35  years  of
dedicated service to the North Lindenhurst Fire Department

WHEREAS,  The firefighters of New York State are renowned throughout the
Nation; their reputation is synonymous with excellence  in  the  arduous
field of fire protection and prevention; and
  WHEREAS,  Since  the  early  days  of "teapot steamers," the volunteer
firefighter has been the cornerstone of our great  Nation's  efforts  to
spare us from the ravages of fire; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is proud to commend Firefighter John J.
Maes  upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition after
35 years of dedicated service to the North Lindenhurst Fire  Department;
and
  WHEREAS,  John J. Maes joined the North Lindenhurst Fire Department in
1976; he was an active firefighter in Hook, Ladder  and  Engine  Company
No.  3  and since has held several positions while serving on the Execu-
tive Board, some of which include Vice President and President; and
  WHEREAS, John J. Maes' spirit of service to his  fellow  citizens  was
truly  demonstrated during the World Trade Center tragedy of 2001; along
with a group of volunteers, he responded to  Ground  Zero  and  assisted
residents to retrieve their personal belongings as well as beloved pets;
and
  WHEREAS,  In addition, John J. Maes was a member of the New York State
Drill Team Champions, the Piston Knockers; and
  WHEREAS, With him throughout have been his wife, and their two  loving
sons,  all of whom feel privileged to be part of his life and rejoice in
his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, Volunteer firefighters and fire departments not only  provide
the  critical service of fire protection but also engage in other activ-
ities of great benefit and importance to the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS, It takes a special dedication, a strong desire to help others
and a tireless sense of community to forsake precious time  with  family
and friends to respond to the signal that a neighbor is in need; John J.
Maes is such a firefighter; throughout 35 years of devoted service, this
volunteer heroically performed, above and beyond the call of duty, those
responsibilities  which  define the task of fire protection; now, there-
fore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That this Legislative Body pause in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Firefighter John J. Maes for 35 years of distinguished service;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Firefighter John J. Maes.
